intro: Blumeopsis, commonly known as the genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae, consists of several species native to Asia. These plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and small, often clustered flowers. They typically have a taproot system and are adapted to grow in temperate climates. The leaves are usually pinnately compound, and the flowers are white or pale yellow. Blumeopsis species are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants.
